alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Stark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:32PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Marshall and northeastern Stark Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 432 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Osceola, or 10 miles east of Kewanee, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Marshall and northeastern Stark Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
